DEFINITION: The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum.
Liquid and semi liquid substances produced by living organisms to fulfill specific functions or excreted as waste; does not include hormones or enzymes.
The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.
A permanently established cell culture that will proliferate indefinitely given appropriate fresh medium and space.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
The main information-processing organs of the nervous system, consisting of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.
A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.
A sample consisting of biological material from the buccal cavity. A collection solution is introduced into the mouth, swished around, and then collected.
Single-stranded long chain of nucleotides containing ribose. It is the end product of DNA transcription by the enzyme RNA polymerase. It is essential in protein synthesis.
The watery fluid in the mouth made by the salivary glands. Saliva moistens food to help digestion and it helps protect the mouth against infections.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body.  It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
Material containing mucus, cellular debris, microorganisms and sometimes blood or pus.  It is ejected through the mouth from the lungs, bronchi, and trachea.
The material discharged from the bowel during defecation.  It consists of undigested food, intestinal mucus, epithelial cells, and bacteria.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.
The transfer of cells, tissues, or organs from a donor into a recipient of another species.
